availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas P. Young, Jr. (Boyle County, Kentucky, 1st corp & 2nd lieut 4th KY In USA)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas P. Young and Mary E. Young. Served in the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first corporal and second lieutenant from October 9, 1861, to May 15, 1865. Captured in Georgia by Confederate forces on July 30, 1864, and escaped at Columbia, South Carolina, in November 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 850.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 192.
Find A Grave, "Thomas P. Young Jr. (1844-1865)," Memorial #59848280, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/59848280 (accessed June 23, 2020).
